gnome-43.commit_message:
Update to Unicode 15 and CLDR 42

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-characters/-/issues/110

gnome-44.commit_message:
appdata: Fix incorrect release tag info

Due to incorrect release info, Debian appstream produces no release
information as shown below:

Releases:
- version: '44.0'
  type: stable
  unix-timestamp: 1679184000
- version: '43.0'
  type: stable
  unix-timestamp: 1663459200
- version: 43~rc
  type: development
  unix-timestamp: 1662163200
- version: 43~beta
  type: development
  unix-timestamp: 1659830400

This causes GNOME Software to display empty or less useful
information. Fixed with the following command:

$ appstreamcli validate org.gnome.Characters.appdata.xml

Refer: https://appstream.debian.org/sid/main/issues/gnome-characters.html.
Refer: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-software/-/issues/2251

window: Remove periods from some phrases

Acc. HIG, "text generally shouldn’t end with a period.
This applies to headings, descriptions, and includes text that is written as a complete sentence".

https://developer.gnome.org/hig/guidelines/writing-style.html

window: Add placeholder text to the search entry

Acc. HIG, "text fields should have placeholder text or a label".

https://developer.gnome.org/hig/patterns/controls/text-fields.html

window: Add tooltips to headerbar buttons

Acc. HIG, "controls in the header bars of primary windows should all have tooltips".

https://developer.gnome.org/hig/patterns/feedback/tooltips.html

Avoid downscaling search result icon

A search result icon was scaled down 2x during pixbuf export, while
being rendered at 48px. This caused noticeable blurriness in shell search
results under 2x display scaling. This commit prevents the downscaling.

Add Interlingue translation

(cherry picked from commit ac762a915c46da90deab8d12549010eb545672c7)

Update to Unicode 15 and CLDR 42

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-characters/-/issues/110

Update Dutch translation

(cherry picked from commit 578456ac1dd8c6e943c4ae53de20316f39d8a10f)

Update Hebrew translation

(cherry picked from commit b19592c61be77e9eace8ad566dbadff61699abbf)

Update Greek translation

(cherry picked from commit c63a3c2629ba2a1b9679bc642ad03e23ecfd9acd)

Update Icelandic translation

(cherry picked from commit 267cac09f54dc31c999d77df2bbe28404bfbbd42)

build: Use install_symlink() function

This removes explicit Python dependency.
Raises required Meson version to 0.61.0.

meson: use the pkg-config file to look for gjs-console

find_program looks for programs for the build machine

the pkg-config file will contain a variable for the host machine gjs-console

main.commit_message: flatpak: Switch away from deprecated app-id

util: use Gio.Settings.new_full()

With recent changes in GNOME/GJS!873 the code to create a Gio.Settings
from a Gio.SettingsSchema and path broke. This can be seen on GNOME OS
in that gnome-characters fails to launch.

  JS ERROR: Error: Value of property 'settings_schema' is not of type Gio.SettingsSchema
  _init@resource:///org/gnome/gjs/modules/core/overrides/Gio.js:747:23
  getSettings@resource:///org/gnome/Characters/js/util.js:72:16
  vfunc_startup@resource:///org/gnome/Characters/js/main.js:83:25
  main@resource:///org/gnome/Characters/js/main.js:121:32
  run@resource:///org/gnome/gjs/modules/script/package.js:206:19
  @/home/christian/.local/bin/gnome-characters:6:17

Fixes #131

appdata: Fix incorrect release tag info

Due to incorrect release info, Debian appstream produces no release
information as shown below:

Releases:
- version: '44.0'
  type: stable
  unix-timestamp: 1679184000
- version: '43.0'
  type: stable
  unix-timestamp: 1663459200
- version: 43~rc
  type: development
  unix-timestamp: 1662163200
- version: 43~beta
  type: development
  unix-timestamp: 1659830400

This causes GNOME Software to display empty or less useful
information. Fixed with the following command:

$ appstreamcli validate org.gnome.Characters.appdata.xml

Refer: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-software/-/issues/2251
Refer: https://appstream.debian.org/sid/main/issues/gnome-characters.html
Refer: https://appstream.debian.org/sid/main/metainfo/gnome-characters.html

searchProvider: reduce MAX_SEARCH_RESULTS to 20

This type of search is highly interactive. The shell only shows 5 matches
for a search provider and so this number only needs to be high enough to
show the user that there are more entries within the application that they
can take a look at. 15 is as good as 95 from this standpoint and it allows
us to bail earlier to process another incoming request.

lib: avoid utf-8 conversion and allocation in hot path

This code checks to see if the keyword is an exact match to the ucs4 value
converted to utf-8. Previously, that code would use g_ucs4_to_utf8() to do
that conversion which gives us the length of the string and a malloc()'d
version of the UTF-8 form.

Instead of allocating the UTF-8 version of the target we can instead
directly compare each ucs4 value to the unichar format of our keyword.

There is a further optimization to be had by pre-calculating the ucs4
version of all the keywords so we can compare them without having to
extract the unichar from the UTF-8 string each time. But that will require
a bit more abstraction on the criteria and my changes to do that weren't
very pretty. So if that is wanted, I'll leave that up to someone who really
digs that sort of work.
lib: plug leak of utf-8 encoded string

lib: reduce calls to g_task_return_error_if_cancelled()

For a simple search result in the gnome-characters UI, we may easily have
20,000 search results (with max-results set to G_MAXUINT). This results
in a huge amount of calls to g_task_return_error_if_cancelled() which can
be as expensive as the other work being done.

Instead, check it infrequently to get the non-local function call out of
the hot path. 2048 was chosen because things are fast enough now that we
can get a bunch of work done in that time without losing much latency.
Additionally, 2048 will turn into `iterations & 0x7FF == 0` when compiled.

lib: inline parsing of hex code-point

This gets called rougly 290,000 times on a single search for one keyword
and therefore could use some optimization. This does both the character
check and the parsing in the same pass. Normally, that might be more
expensive because you have to do extra work than just checking characters,
but strspn() returns the offset in the substring and therefore is doing
additional unnecessary work anyway and this will likely bail on the first
character in the negative case.

lib: use strstr() directly

The compiler can do a whole host of optimizations when strstr() is used
directly rather than through an indirect function call to g_strstr_len().

Now that we are certain the buffer is \0 terminated, just use strstr()
directly to get this speed-up.
lib: fix potential leak of buffer for character name
lib: ensure get_character_name() always \0 terminates string

lib: pre-compile termlist keyword lengths

When generating the criteria for keywords, we can track the length of the
term up-front and shave off a few hundred thousand calls to strlen().
characterDialog: Don't visibly replace related rows during animation

window: Unpack recent-characters GValue

Currently `get_strv()` causes a crash due to a GJS issue.

util: Use Gdk.TextureDownloader to get icon data

Avoid passing through GdkPixbuf if Gdk.TextureDownloader is available.

Update Greek translation

(cherry picked from commit 7e5136f24274129adc2d0a27a55cdbec7677bf8e)

Update British English translation

(cherry picked from commit c447abe0ccb25dd8b32281f7b2ac4532d7134390)

flatpak: Make it compatible with latest CI template changes

- Add run-tests & test-args needed when running tests using flatpak-builder directly
- Switch to source to type dir as that is the correct thing to have for IDE integration & CI
tests: Do not install smoke test by default
tests: Add JS tests to installed tests

util: Do not include empty strings in search results

Just avoid to return them, given these are not rendered anyways.

Add test.
tests: Add basic test for Gc.Search and Util.searchResultToArray

util: Avoid calling C functions when JS detects white spaces

There's no need to do C calls and initialize stuff when JS can figure out
that we're handling an empty string.

This works also for more-complex utf-8 white spaces.

Related to: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-characters/-/issues/124

util: Do not try to render whitespace characters

Gsk is not supposed to render whitespace characters, as those are just
empty boxes, and these are likely not relevant results for the shell search
provider either, so let's just skip them.

See: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk/-/issues/5747
Fixes: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-characters/-/issues/124

meson: Pass the app data file as is to validation tool

Otherwise meson won't able to consider it a test dependency
util: Try to use the CairoRenderer if the GL one is not available
tests: Add simple tests to check Util.characterToIconData

searchProvider: Keep the application active while searching

Prevent the application to be closed while the search provider is
performing any action. So that the search is always completed.

This should also prevent that we're destroying the Gsk.GLRenderer before
we've correctly unrealized it.

To avoid the releasing to stop the application immediately, we also need
to explicitly set the inactivity timeout (using GApplication default).

Helps with: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-characters/-/issues/124

Update Icelandic translation

(cherry picked from commit ccb976a57dcd480e7836c5f5a835c2c8be7e89b0)

Update Slovak translation

(cherry picked from commit 5f9172544afd9d84e400ff1b28bbd6e6181834b9)

gc: Fix visibility for zerowidth characters

Some characters were marked as invisible because they have zerowidth
while they are actually printable (e.g. U+0941).

Fixes #113
window: Remove unused primary menu code

search: Fix block edge case

When searching for characters that are at the end of their block
(e.g U+017F of the Latin Extended-A block) the search didn't compare
the last character. This caused several characters to be unreachable
with a search.

Fixes #82 #96

gc: add support cjk extension H for Unicode15

add support CJK Unified Ideographs Extension H for Unicode 15

In Unicode Version 15.0, new CJK Unified Udeographs Extension H is released.

Block Name: CJK Unified Ideographs Extension H
Range: 31350..323AF

add CJK Unified Ideographs Extension H for Unicode 15 on GNOME Characters
So, modify cjk_block_starters array

Ref. CJK Unified Ideographs Extension H
https://www.unicode.org/charts/PDF/Unicode-15.0/U150-31350.pdf

shortcuts: Improve strings

- Fix Main Menu name
- Add header capitalization
- Phrase "Keyboard shortcuts" as an action

window: Set Main Menu button as primary

It isn't necessary to manually assign a shortcut to the
Main Menu button. By setting this menu button as primary, the F10
key automatically triggers the Main Menu.

window: Remove max sidebar width

This is the new default value.

window: Expand search entry to the full width

Since sidebar width is now dynamic, fixed width entry looks out of place.

Update Italian translation

(cherry picked from commit 15229dc19da7a988ca9a4fb3062ebe8216f93ee1)

window: Remove periods from some phrases

Acc. HIG, "text generally shouldn’t end with a period.
This applies to headings, descriptions, and includes text that is written as a complete sentence".

https://developer.gnome.org/hig/guidelines/writing-style.html

window: Add placeholder text to the search entry

Acc. HIG, "text fields should have placeholder text or a label".

https://developer.gnome.org/hig/patterns/controls/text-fields.html

window: Add tooltips to headerbar buttons

Acc. HIG, "controls in the header bars of primary windows should all have tooltips".

https://developer.gnome.org/hig/patterns/feedback/tooltips.html

Avoid downscaling search result icon

A search result icon was scaled down 2x during pixbuf export, while
being rendered at 48px. This caused noticeable blurriness in shell search
results under 2x display scaling. This commit prevents the downscaling.

Add Interlingue translation

(cherry picked from commit ac762a915c46da90deab8d12549010eb545672c7)

Update to Unicode 15 and CLDR 42

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-characters/-/issues/110

Update Dutch translation

(cherry picked from commit 578456ac1dd8c6e943c4ae53de20316f39d8a10f)

Update Hebrew translation

(cherry picked from commit b19592c61be77e9eace8ad566dbadff61699abbf)

Update Greek translation

(cherry picked from commit c63a3c2629ba2a1b9679bc642ad03e23ecfd9acd)

Update Icelandic translation

(cherry picked from commit 267cac09f54dc31c999d77df2bbe28404bfbbd42)

build: Use install_symlink() function

This removes explicit Python dependency.
Raises required Meson version to 0.61.0.

meson: use the pkg-config file to look for gjs-console

find_program looks for programs for the build machine

the pkg-config file will contain a variable for the host machine gjs-console

Otherwise meson won't able to consider it a test dependency
util: Try to use the CairoRenderer if the GL one is not available
tests: Add simple tests to check Util.characterToIconData

searchProvider: Keep the application active while searching

Prevent the application to be closed while the search provider is
performing any action. So that the search is always completed.

This should also prevent that we're destroying the Gsk.GLRenderer before
we've correctly unrealized it.

To avoid the releasing to stop the application immediately, we also need
to explicitly set the inactivity timeout (using GApplication default).

Helps with: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-characters/-/issues/124

Update Icelandic translation

(cherry picked from commit ccb976a57dcd480e7836c5f5a835c2c8be7e89b0)

Update Slovak translation

(cherry picked from commit 5f9172544afd9d84e400ff1b28bbd6e6181834b9)

gc: Fix visibility for zerowidth characters

Some characters were marked as invisible because they have zerowidth
while they are actually printable (e.g. U+0941).

Fixes #113
window: Remove unused primary menu code

search: Fix block edge case

When searching for characters that are at the end of their block
(e.g U+017F of the Latin Extended-A block) the search didn't compare
the last character. This caused several characters to be unreachable
with a search.

Fixes #82 #96

gc: add support cjk extension H for Unicode15

add support CJK Unified Ideographs Extension H for Unicode 15

In Unicode Version 15.0, new CJK Unified Udeographs Extension H is released.

Block Name: CJK Unified Ideographs Extension H
Range: 31350..323AF

add CJK Unified Ideographs Extension H for Unicode 15 on GNOME Characters
So, modify cjk_block_starters array

Ref. CJK Unified Ideographs Extension H
https://www.unicode.org/charts/PDF/Unicode-15.0/U150-31350.pdf

shortcuts: Improve strings

- Fix Main Menu name
- Add header capitalization
- Phrase "Keyboard shortcuts" as an action

window: Set Main Menu button as primary

It isn't necessary to manually assign a shortcut to the
Main Menu button. By setting this menu button as primary, the F10
key automatically triggers the Main Menu.

window: Remove max sidebar width

This is the new default value.

window: Expand search entry to the full width

Since sidebar width is now dynamic, fixed width entry looks out of place.

Update Italian translation

(cherry picked from commit 15229dc19da7a988ca9a4fb3062ebe8216f93ee1)

window: Remove periods from some phrases

Acc. HIG, "text generally shouldn’t end with a period.
This applies to headings, descriptions, and includes text that is written as a complete sentence".

https://developer.gnome.org/hig/guidelines/writing-style.html

window: Add placeholder text to the search entry

Acc. HIG, "text fields should have placeholder text or a label".

https://developer.gnome.org/hig/patterns/controls/text-fields.html

window: Add tooltips to headerbar buttons

Acc. HIG, "controls in the header bars of primary windows should all have tooltips".

https://developer.gnome.org/hig/patterns/feedback/tooltips.html

Avoid downscaling search result icon

A search result icon was scaled down 2x during pixbuf export, while
being rendered at 48px. This caused noticeable blurriness in shell search
results under 2x display scaling. This commit prevents the downscaling.

Add Interlingue translation

(cherry picked from commit ac762a915c46da90deab8d12549010eb545672c7)

Update to Unicode 15 and CLDR 42

Fixes https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-characters/-/issues/110

(cherry picked from commit 578456ac1dd8c6e943c4ae53de20316f39d8a10f)

(cherry picked from commit b19592c61be77e9eace8ad566dbadff61699abbf)

Update Greek translation

(cherry picked from commit c63a3c2629ba2a1b9679bc642ad03e23ecfd9acd)

Update Icelandic translation

(cherry picked from commit 267cac09f54dc31c999d77df2bbe28404bfbbd42)

build: Use install_symlink() function

This removes explicit Python dependency.
Raises required Meson version to 0.61.0.

meson: use the pkg-config file to look for gjs-console

find_program looks for programs for the build machine

the pkg-config file will contain a variable for the host machine gjs-console
